reference.text: measuring liquid level G01F; radio navigation, determining distance or velocity by use of propagation effects, e.g. Doppler effects, propagation time, of radio waves, analogous arrangements using other waves G01S

note.note-paragraph: In this subclass, the following term is used with the meaning indicated: "navigation" means determining the position and course of land vehicles, ships, aircraft, and space vehicles.
Attention is drawn to the Notes following the title of class G01.

The following IPC groups are not in the CPC scheme. The subject matter for these IPC groups is classified in the following CPC groups:
G01C11/36 covered by G01C11/00-G01C11/34
In this subclass non-limiting references (in the sense of paragraph 39 of the Guide to the IPC) may still be displayed in the scheme.

title-part.text: Measuring distances in line of sight

reference.text: tapes, chains or wheels for measuring length G01B3/00; active triangulation systems, i.e. using the transmission and reflection of electromagnetic waves other than radio waves, G01S17/48

Caging, i.e. immobilising moving parts, e.g. for transport

Group G01C21/00 is impacted by reclassification into groups G01C21/38 - G01C21/3896.
All groups listed in this Warning should be considered in order to perform a complete search.

CPC-specific-text.text: specially adapted for specific applications
Dynamic re-routing, e.g. recalculating the route when the user deviates from calculated route or after detecting real-time traffic data or accidents
Multimodal routing, i.e. combining two or more modes of transportation, where the modes can be any of, e.g. driving, walking, cycling, public transport
Calculating itineraries, i.e. routes leading from a starting point to a series of categorical destinations using a global route restraint, round trips, touristic trips

reference.text: travelling salesman problem G06Q10/04; optimisation of routes G06Q10/047

CPC-specific-text.text: Rendez-vous, i.e. searching a destination where several users can meet, and the routes to this destination for these users; Ride sharing, i.e. searching a route such that at least two users can share a vehicle for at least part of the route
Details of route searching algorithms, e.g. Dijkstra, A*, arc-flags, using precalculated routes
Special cost functions, i.e. other than distance or default speed limit of road segments
Preferred or disfavoured areas, e.g. dangerous zones, toll or emission zones, intersections, manoeuvre types, segments such as motorways, toll roads, ferries
Fuel consumption; Energy use; Emission aspects
using point of interest [POI] information, e.g. a route passing visible POIs
Personalized, e.g. from learned user behaviour or user-defined profiles
employing speed data or traffic data, e.g. real-time or historical

reference.text: traffic control systems for road vehicles involving transmission of navigation instructions to the vehicle G08G1/0968

Destination input or retrieval
using speech input, e.g. using speech recognition
using character input or menus, e.g. menus of POIs

reference.text: character input methods in general G06F3/0233

using user history, behaviour, conditions or preferences, e.g. predicted or inferred from previous use or current movement
received from an external device or application, e.g. PDA, mobile phone or calendar application
using a camera or code reader, e.g. for optical or magnetic codes
Details of the output of route guidance instructions

reference.text: traffic control systems for road vehicles involving transmission of navigation instructions to the vehicle G08G1/0968

CPC-specific-text.text: Guidance using speech or audio output, e.g. text-to-speech

reference.text: text to speech systems per se G10L13/00

CPC-specific-text.text: Guidance using simplified or iconic instructions, e.g. using arrows
Guidance using 3D or perspective road maps
including 3D objects and buildings

reference.text: three dimensional [3D] modelling, e.g. data description of 3D objects G06T17/00; geographic models G06T17/05

CPC-specific-text.text: Personalized guidance, e.g. limited guidance on previously travelled routes
Landmark guidance, e.g. using POIs or conspicuous other objects
Guidance involving output of stored or live camera images or video streams
Guidance using head up displays or projectors, e.g. virtual vehicles or arrows projected on the windscreen or on the road itself
Guidance using non-audiovisual output, e.g. tactile, haptic or electric stimuli
Timing of guidance instructions
Lane guidance
Guidance output on an external device, e.g. car radio
Details of the user input interface, e.g. buttons, knobs or sliders, including those provided on a touch screen; remote controllers; input using gestures
Display of a road map

reference.text: G01C21/3614 takes precedence; guidance using 3D or perspective road maps G01C21/3635

CPC-specific-text.text: Details, e.g. road map scale, orientation, zooming, illumination, level of detail, scrolling of road map or positioning of current position marker
Labelling using text of road map data items, e.g. road names, POI names
Overview of the route on the road map
Retrieval, searching and output of POI information, e.g. hotels, restaurants, shops, filling stations, parking facilities
output of POI information on a road map
the POI's being parking facilities
Systems comprising multiple parts or multiple output devices (not client-server), e.g. detachable faceplates, key fobs or multiple output screens
Retrieval, searching and output of information related to real-time traffic, weather, or environmental conditions

reference.text: arrangements for giving variable traffic instructions G08G1/09

CPC-specific-text.text: Output thereof on a road map
Output of additional, non-guidance related information, e.g. low fuel level
Electronic maps specially adapted for navigation; Updating thereof

note.note-paragraph:
Groups G01C21/38 - G01C21/3896 are incomplete pending reclassification of documents from groups G01C21/00 and G01C21/32.
Groups G01C21/00, G01C21/32, and G01C21/38 - G01C21/3896 should be considered in order to perform a complete search.

CPC-specific-text.text: Creation or updating of map data
characterised by the type of data
Point data, e.g. Point of Interest [POI]
Road data
Road shape data, e.g. outline of a route
Road feature data, e.g. slope data
Terrain data
Indoor data
characterised by the source of data
Data obtained from a single source
Data obtained from two or more sources, e.g. probe vehicles
Data obtained from position sensors only, e.g. from inertial navigation
Data obtained from both position sensors and additional sensors
Data derived from aerial or satellite images
Data obtained from user input
Differential updating map data
Structures of map data
Geometry of map features, e.g. shape points, polygons or for simplified maps
Organisation of map data, e.g. version management or database structures
Structures specially adapted for data searching and retrieval
Hierarchical structures, e.g. layering
Tile-based structures
Transmission of map data to client devices; Reception of map data by client devices
Transmission of selected map data, e.g. depending on route
Transmission of map data from distributed sources, e.g. from roadside stations
Transmission of map data from central databases

for skates
